snippet: A report highlights the work done by New York agencies to trace the origin of 28 outbreaks and stem further spread of ciguatera, a type of fish poisoning.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention report highlights outbreak of ciguatera, a type of fish poisoning, in New York City in 2010 and 2011; reason for spike is unclear but may reflect changing sources and diversity of fish species marketed in the city.
lead_paragraph: A report highlights the work done by New York agencies to trace the origin of 28 outbreaks and stem further spread of ciguatera, a type of fish poisoning.

headline.seo: Toxic Fish Caused Food-Poisoning Outbreaks, Report Says
headline.main: Fish Toxin Cited as Cause of Poisonings in ’10 and ’11
headline.print_headline: Fish Toxin Is Cited as Cause Of Poisonings in ’10 and ’11

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
